name: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Capital Dashboard Agencies Summary - All Load Dates
attribution: MTA Headquarters, New York City Transit, Long Island Rail Road, Metro-North Railroad, MTA Bus and MTA Bridges and Tunnels
description: The Capital Dashboard data provides information about the projects in the MTA’s 2010 to 2014 and 2005 – 2009 Capital Programs.  The data describes the planned projects and provide information about the status of Project Budgets, Scopes and Schedules.

columns.name: Project Number
columns.description: A capital project that invests funds over one or more phases of work (i.e., planning, design, purchase and installation, construction) to deliver a defined benefit (e.g., rehabilitating existing assets, improving or expanding the system). The field is a unique project identification code created by concatenating the AGENCY_CODE, CATEGORY, ELEMENT, and PROJECT.

columns.name: Capital Plan
columns.description: An investment plan of the MTA Capital Program that links specific funding sources to planned investment projects over a particular period of time, typically 5-years.

columns.name: Load Date
columns.description: The Capital Program Dashboard is published on a quarterly basis. The LOADDATE field represents the quarter assoctaed with the data.

columns.name: Plan Revision Keys
columns.description: These are the Plan Admendment Keys that will be needed to link to the PLAN_REV field in the Capital Dashboard Detail data. The keys are all in one field because the number of keys can vary for each PROj_NUM. (Format: YYYYMM)

columns.name: Plan Revision Display Keys
columns.description: These are the Plan Admendment Keys that are displayed on the detail page for each project. These can also be used to link to the BUDGET_SUBMISSION_DATE field in the Capital Dashboard Detail data.

columns.name: Agency Code
columns.description:
MTA Operating Agency

columns.name: Category
columns.description: This field shows the capital investment category.

columns.name: Element
columns.description: This field shows the element, a subset of a category.

columns.name: Project
columns.description: This field shows a unique code that identifies each project within an element.

columns.name: Agency Name
columns.description: This field shows the descriptive MTA operating agency title.

columns.name: Category Description
columns.description: This field shows the descriptive category title.

columns.name: Element Description
columns.description: This field shows the descriptive category title.

columns.name: Project Description
columns.description: This field shows the descriptive project title.

columns.name: Scope Objective
columns.description: This narrative provides a summary level description of the project.

cachedContents.largest: Work to restore the south abutment and seawall included repair of the exposed base of the wing wall; removal and rebuilding of the walkway east of the south abutment; repair of damaged riprap and replacement of damaged reinforced concrete pipe (RCP) at the east side of the abutment; replacement of displaced riprap and removal and rebuilding of the asphalt walkway at the west side of the abutment; and encasement of exposed conduits. Dates not shown due to project being advanced in operating budget.

top.item: This project will provide the annual Track Force Account for the maintenance of segments of mainline track. The work will include replacement, restoration and reconstruction of related trackway equipment and materials such as third rail and signals. The work must be performed using in-house labor and materials.

This project will replace yard switches that have reached the end of their useful life at various locations throughout the system. Locations were selected based on the latest Yard Switch Condition Survey.

This project will replace yard track that has reached the end of its useful life at various locations throughout the system. Locations will be selected based on the latest Yard Track Condition Survey.

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the Brighton line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the Flushing line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).

This program will reduce the number of broken rails in subway tracks and improve the condition of track plates and ties in subway tunnels, extending their useful life. Work will include surface preparation and replacement of obsolete plates, spikes, and jointed rail with new welded rail along with any associated cable and signal work.

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the Pelham line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).
Project established by the May '17 Plan Amendment to address future flood resiliency needs. Project under development.

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the Jerome line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).

This project was to provide for the normal replacement of non-revenue rubber tire support vehicles with a replacement cost of $50,000 or greater. These vehicles are used by NYCT for essential services such as emergency response, material transportation, track repair and elevated structure repair.

This project will install new Help Points intercom system at various station locations. Help Points are highly visible intercom devices allowing customers to speak directly to New York City Transit employees for travel information and emergency assistance. Help Points shall replace the existing Customer Assistance Intercoms.

This project will provide for the normal replacement of non-revenue rubber tire support vehicles with a replacement cost of $50,000 or greater. These vehicles are used by NYCT for essential services such as emergency response, material transportation, track repair and elevated structure repair.

This project will continue the cyclical replacement and renewal of ties, surfacing and grade crossings on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven (in New York State) Lines to ensure a safe, comfortable ride for Metro-North customers.

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the White Plains Road line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).
This project implements various small-scale construction work or miscellaneous equipment purchases.

This project will fund various systemwide mainline track reconstruction projects. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc.). Funding from this project will be transferred to individual track projects for construction activities; the remaining balance in this project will be for design and support costs.

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the Concourse line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).

This project will reconstruct segments of mainline track that have reached the end of their useful life on the West End line. Work will include the replacement of track and associated equipment/materials (e.g. signals, contact rail, ballast, etc).

This project will fund various mainline switches replacement projects. Work will include, as required, replacement of existing turnouts, track switches, switch valves, connecting rails, contact rails, ties, ballast, signal cable including positive and negative connections, and any associated signal and equipment work. Funding from this project will be transferred to individual track projects for construction activities; the remaining balance in this project will be for design and support costs.

columns.name: Phase
columns.description: This field shows the Current phase for each project. Projects begin in Planning, progress to Design, then Construction and finally Completion.

columns.name: Original Budget
columns.description: This field shows the original MTA Board (or Capital Program Review Board) approved budget amount for each project.

columns.name: Current Budget
columns.description: This field shows the latest available value for the project budget as recorded in the MTA Capital Program Management System.

columns.name: Original Budget vs Current Budget
columns.description: This calculated field shows the difference between the Original Budget and the Current Budget as a percentage of the Original Budget. A budget decrease exceeding 10% is indicated by green text, a budget increase exceeding 10% is indicated by red text on t

columns.name: Overall Scope Change
columns.description:
This field indicates a change in overall project scope.
I = Increase / D =  Decrease / blank =  'No Change'

columns.name: Original Start Month
columns.description: This field shows the Original Construction Start Date or the start date of major activity for each project.

columns.name: Original Start Year
columns.description: This field shows the Original Construction Start Date or the start date of major activity for each project.

columns.name: Current Start Year
columns.description: This field shows the Current Project Start Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Current Start Month
columns.description: This field shows the Current Project Start Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Original Completion Month
columns.description: This field shows the Original Project Completion Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Original Completion Year
columns.description: This field shows the Original Project Completion Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Current Completion Month
columns.description: This field shows the Current Project Completion Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Current Completion Year
columns.description: This field shows the Current Project Completion Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Design Start Month
columns.description: This field shows the Design Start Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Design Start Year
columns.description: This field shows the Design Start Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Design Completion Month
columns.description: This field shows the Design Completion Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Design Completion Year
columns.description: This field shows the Design Completion Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Construction Start Month
columns.description: This field shows the Construction Start Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Construction Start Year
columns.description: This field shows the Construction Start Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Construction Completion Month
columns.description: This field shows the Construction Completion Date Month for each project.

columns.name: Construction Completion Year
columns.description: This field shows the Construction Completion Date Year for each project.

columns.name: Percentage Complete
columns.description: This field shows the percentage based on the total project budget expended.

columns.name: Current Quarter Flag
columns.description: CQ indicates the Load Date Records that are the most current  quarter data published to the MTA CapitalDashboard

columns.name: Location Indicator
columns.description:
This indicates whether a project has a single or multiple locations, or a system wide project, or related to rolling stock such as buses or train cars, and funding for other projects.
Example:
•	Base:  A project has one location and must include a Latitude and Longitude value. 
•	Multilocation:  A project has multiple locations relatively close to one another. There will be multiple lines for the project, each having a unique set of Latitude and Longitude values. 
•	Systemwide: Projects that span large areas such as track work or variety of system projects. 
•	Car: Projects that deal with Rolling Stock for railroad or subway cars. 
•	Bus: A project that deals with Rolling Stock for buses.  
•	Dollar: Projects that are set up to hold funding for other projects.

Dataset Summary.Coverage: New York Metropolitan Area and Connecticut

Disclaimers.Disclaimer: The information provided for the MTA’s 2010 to 2014 plan contains all projects. The MTA’s 2005 – 2009 plan data is only for selected projects based on the following criteria:  Projects under construction but not completed and with budgets over $20 Million dollars; For Metro-North, some projects under $20 Million have been included.  Projects funded under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act.   All projects in the 2005 - 2009 Capital Plan for East Side Access, Second Ave Subway, and the Flushing Line Extension.

Notes.Notes: The current budget values are a snapshot of the budget at the close of the published quarter.
